item.title: India vs Australia LIVE 3rd Test, Day 5: Early Lunch Taken But Some Good News For Cricket Fans - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE 3rd Test, Day 5: Jasprit Bumrah Draws 1st Blood, Gets Rid Of Usman Khawaja

Publication Date: N/A | Source: NDTV

On the fifth day of the 3rd Test, Jasprit Bumrah made a significant impact by taking the wicket of Usman Khawaja, marking an exciting phase in the match between India and Australia.

  • Jasprit Bumrah initiated the breakthroughs for India on Day 5 by dismissing Usman Khawaja.
  • The match has seen competitive performances from both teams, with tension building up as they approach the final stages.
  • Bumrah’s wicket could change the momentum in favor of India.
“This wicket is crucial for our strategy moving forward in the match,” said a key player from the Indian team.

As the day progresses, all eyes are on the Indian bowlers to maintain their pressure and capitalize on this early success.

item.title: Watch: Akash Deep says 'sorry sorry' after irritating Travis Head - The Times of India
item.description:
Watch: Akash Deep says 'sorry sorry' after irritating Travis Head

Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

The fifth day of the third Test between India and Australia was marked by a light-hearted incident involving Akash Deep and Travis Head. Deep, who had been playing well, unintentionally confused Head during the game.

  • Day 5 of the third Test saw India bowled out for 260 runs.
  • Akash Deep had a notable partnership with Jasprit Bumrah, scoring a defiant 47 runs for the last wicket.
  • A humorous moment occurred when Deep accidentally dropped the ball from his pads, frustrating Head.
  • Deep lightened the moment by apologizing with a 'sorry sorry,' leading to laughter from commentators.
  • Shortly after, Deep was stumped by Alex Carey, allowing Australia to take a significant lead.
“Sorry sorry,” Akash Deep said, prompting laughter from commentators and a wry smile from Travis Head.

This incident brought some levity to the tense match conditions and showcased the lighter side of cricket amidst competitive play.

item.title: Bilkul Hi Nahi Hai Bhookh ": Shubman Gill Blasted By Ex-Pakistan Star After Yet Another Poor Show - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Bilkul Hi Nahi Hai Bhookh: Shubman Gill Blasted By Ex-Pakistan Star After Yet Another Poor Show

Published on: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV

Shubman Gill has faced criticism following his poor performance in the Test series against Australia, with former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali pointing out his lack of hunger for runs.

  • Shubman Gill dismissed for just 1 run in the third Test against Australia.
  • Basit Ali emphasizes the importance of focusing on performance instead of comparing oneself to established players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • India's team avoided a follow-on but still trails by 193 runs after scoring 252 for nine.
  • Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul were key contributors, scoring 77 and 84 runs respectively.
  • The five-match series is currently tied at 1-1.
"Gill ko toh bilkul hi nahi hai bhookh (Gill is not hungry at all for runs)." - Basit Ali

The criticism highlights the pressure on young players in high-stakes cricket, especially in challenging Test series.

item.title: Akash Deep Apologises Following Bizarre Exchange With Travis Head During Brisbane Test - Watch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Akash Deep Apologises Following Bizarre Exchange With Travis Head During Brisbane Test - Watch

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Akash Deep apologised to Travis Head following a bizarre exchange during the third Test match between India and Australia in Brisbane. The incident occurred when Akash Deep missed a ball, leading to an unexpected interaction with Head.

  • Akash Deep attempted an aggressive shot against Nathan Lyon.
  • The ball got stuck in Deep's pads, which he threw to the ground, causing confusion with Travis Head.
  • Despite the awkward moment, Deep apologised and play continued smoothly.
  • The day was marked by multiple delays due to weather conditions.
Don't think Travis Head loved that — cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) December 18, 2024

Ultimately, Travis Head dismissed Akash Deep, contributing to the end of India's innings.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE 3rd Test, Day 5: No Rain But Umpires Stop Play At Gabba. Reason Is... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE 3rd Test, Day 5: Rain In Brisbane After Umpires Stop Game For This Reason

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: NDTV

The fifth day of the third Test match between India and Australia in Brisbane faced interruptions due to rain, leading umpires to stop the game.

  • Umpires halted the match because of rain conditions.
  • Impact on the match's schedule and player performances.
“Rain delays are part of cricket, but they always frustrate both players and fans.”

In conclusion, the rain has affected the day's gameplay significantly, underscoring the unpredictable nature of outdoor sports.

item.title: Prithvi Shaw's Instagram outburst backfires as youngster handed stern warning: 'Just by looking at his frame…' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prithvi Shaw Faces Criticism After Instagram Outburst

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prithvi Shaw, once the celebrated young talent in Indian cricket, has found himself under scrutiny after being dropped from Mumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad due to fitness and performance issues. Following his exclusion, he took to Instagram to defend himself by sharing his List-A statistics, admitting that he feels he is not good enough.

  • Shaw needs to improve his fitness and discipline after being omitted from the Vijay Hazare Trophy squad.
  • Despite once being dubbed the future star of Indian cricket, his opportunities have dwindled with only 12 international matches played.
  • Performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy was subpar, with an average below 25.
  • He went unsold in the IPL auction, raising further concerns about his career trajectory.
  • Coaches emphasize the need for hard work and commitment to realize his potential.
"Just by looking at his frame, the fitness issues are there for everyone to see." - Source from the Mumbai Cricket Association

In conclusion, Shaw's situation serves as a reminder of the delicate balance between talent and discipline in sports, highlighting the challenges athletes face in maintaining their careers amidst scrutiny.

item.title: Google joins Indian cricket fans to say: I only believe in Jassi Bhai - The Times of India
item.description:
Google Aligns with Indian Cricket Fans: 'I Only Believe in Jassi Bhai'

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a heartwarming gesture, Google has joined the ranks of cricket fans in India by proclaiming 'I only believe in Jassi Bhai', celebrating the love for cricket and its cultural impact.

  • Google's initiative highlights its connection to Indian culture through cricket.
  • Fans are actively participating in discussions around this sentiment on social media.
  • The phrase 'I only believe in Jassi Bhai' has become a rallying cry among cricket enthusiasts.
“This phrase resonates deeply within the community, emphasizing loyalty and passion for cricket.”

This initiative shows how global brands like Google can connect deeply with local cultures, fostering community spirit among cricket fans in India.

item.title: Elon Musk, Sundar Pichai react to Jasprit Bumrah's 'Google it' remark on his batting skills - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Elon Musk and Sundar Pichai React to Jasprit Bumrah's 'Google It' Remark

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

After Jasprit Bumrah's witty remark about his batting, Google CEO Sundar Pichai praised him on X, while Elon Musk added a brief compliment.

  • Jasprit Bumrah humorously suggested that a journalist should use Google to assess his batting skills.
  • Sundar Pichai praised Bumrah's batting performance, referencing a specific instance of his ability.
  • Elon Musk responded positively to Pichai's compliment.
  • Pichai suggested they watch a cricket match together in the future.
“I did Google it. Anyone who can hook Cummins for a six knows how to bat!” – Sundar Pichai

This exchange highlights the intersection of sports, technology, and celebrity, showcasing how public figures engage with culture.

item.title: Sanju Samson excluded from Kerala’s Vijay Hazare Trophy squad after not attending camp - The Indian Express
item.description:
Sanju Samson Excluded from Kerala’s Vijay Hazare Trophy Squad

Publication Date: October 12, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

India's wicket-keeper Sanju Samson has been left out of Kerala's squad for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy after failing to attend the team's preparatory camp.

  • Samson led Kerala to a third-place finish in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy but did not report for the subsequent team camp.
  • The squad was formed after a brief camp in Wayanad, which Samson missed due to an email stating his unavailability.
  • Salman Nizar will captain the team in Samson's absence.
  • Samson's last 50-over game was during India's tour of South Africa in December 2023, where he scored an unbeaten century.
“Sanju had sent an email stating that he would not be available for the camp. Naturally, we only considered those who were part of the sessions for selection.” - Vinod S Kumar, KCA Secretary

In conclusion, Sanju Samson's absence from the camp has resulted in his exclusion from the upcoming tournament, with the team moving forward with new leadership under Salman Nizar.

item.title: Dottin, Matthews make easy work of India in series-levelling win - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
West Indies Levels T20I Series Against India with Dominant Win

Date: Not specified

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

West Indies secured a commanding nine-wicket victory over India, leveling the T20I series with a stellar performance from captain Hayley Matthews.

  • West Indies scored 160 for 1, chasing down India's total of 159 for 9.
  • Hayley Matthews was the standout performer, scoring an unbeaten 85 from 54 balls.
  • India's Smriti Mandhana top-scored for her team with 62 runs.
  • West Indies bounced back strongly after losing nine consecutive T20I matches against India.
  • Deandra Dottin and Afy Fletcher took two wickets each, helping restrict India to a low score.
“The series couldn't have been leveled with a more emphatic chase.”

The West Indies' performance showcased their batting depth and resilience, setting the stage for an exciting conclusion to the series.

item.title: Heather Knight: Lack of DRS 'shows the status' of women's Test cricket - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Heather Knight: Lack of DRS 'shows the status' of women's Test cricket

Publication Date: Recent
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Heather Knight, the captain of England's women's cricket team, expressed concerns over the absence of the Decision Review System (DRS) in their recent historic Test against South Africa, interpreting it as a reflection of the game's status. England achieved a significant 286-run victory, marking their first win in this format in a decade.

  • The absence of DRS was noted during contentious umpiring decisions.
  • South Africa ended their innings at 64 all out in their fourth innings.
  • Multiple umpiring calls went against South Africa, which could have been resolved with DRS.
  • South Africa's coach, Mandla Mashimbyi, found the decision process surrounding the calls confusing.
  • Knight pointed out the financial implications responsible for not utilizing DRS.
“It’s probably a sign of the status of this game, maybe, that we didn’t have it, which is a bit frustrating.” - Heather Knight

The lack of DRS has raised questions about investment in women’s cricket, especially given that Cricket South Africa reported a profit of R815 million for the fiscal year.

item.title: Rs 5 crore award for Gukesh! Tamil Nadu CM felicitates World Chess Champion - The Times of India
item.description:
Rs 5 crore award for Gukesh! Tamil Nadu CM felicitates World Chess Champion

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister has honored chess prodigy Gukesh D for his remarkable victory in the World Chess Championship, presenting him with a generous award of Rs 5 crore.

  • Gukesh D emerged as a global champion, showcasing exceptional skill.
  • The state government acknowledged his achievement by offering financial support as a token of appreciation.
  • This accolade highlights the rising popularity of chess in India.
“This award is a testament to Gukesh's dedication and brilliance in chess,” said the Chief Minister.

The event underscores India's growing prominence in the chess world, celebrating young talents who are making significant strides.

item.title: West Indies vs Bangladesh Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 2nd T20I match between WI vs BAN? - CricTracker
item.description:
West Indies vs Bangladesh Match Prediction - Who will win today’s 2nd T20I match between WI vs BAN?

Date & Source: December 18, 2024, CricTracker

The West Indies aim to bounce back against Bangladesh in the second T20I after losing the first match by seven runs. Bangladesh leads the series 1-0.

Key Points:

  • Bangladesh scored 147 runs in the first T20I.
  • West Indies struggled in their chase, with Rovman Powell being the only significant scorer, making 60 runs.
  • Mahedi Hasan was named Player of the Match for his four wickets.
  • Pitch conditions at Arnos Vale Ground favor bowlers, which could lead to a low-scoring game.

Notable Quotes:

“Today's Match Prediction: Team Bowling first to win the match.”

The upcoming match is crucial for West Indies as they look to level the series. Both teams will have to navigate the challenges posed by the pitch to secure victory.

item.title: How can India qualify for WTC final 2025 if Gabba Test ends in draw/loss vs Australia? Qualification scenarios explained - The Indian Express
item.description:
How can India qualify for WTC final 2025 if Gabba Test ends in draw/loss vs Australia? Qualification scenarios explained

Publication Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Indian Express

India's chances of qualifying for the ICC World Test Championship (WTC) 2025 final could significantly decline if they do not secure a win against Australia in the ongoing series, especially if the match in Brisbane ends in a draw or loss.

  • India's WTC points percentage (PCT) will decrease from 57.29 to 55.88 in case of a draw and further to 53.92 with a loss.
  • India remains third in the WTC standings behind South Africa and Australia.
  • For WTC 2025 final qualification, India must avoid any more defeats and can only afford one draw in their remaining matches.
“If the Gabba Test ends in a draw, Rohit and Co. can accumulate 138 points at a 60.52 PCT with two outright wins.”

The Adelaide Test win solidified Australia's position in the standings, highlighting the challenges India faces in securing their place in the WTC finals.

item.title: Mumbai Techie, 31, Dies Of Heart Attack While Playing Cricket - NDTV
item.description:
Mumbai Techie, 31, Dies Of Heart Attack While Playing Cricket

Publication Date: Recent News

Source: NDTV

A 31-year-old software engineer, Vikram Ashok Deshmukh, tragically passed away due to a heart attack while playing cricket in Mumbai.

  • Deshmukh was playing a 25-over practice match at Azad Maidan.
  • He complained of chest pain in the 10th over but continued playing.
  • He collapsed after taking a run in the 17th over and was later pronounced dead in the hospital.
  • He is survived by his wife, parents, and a one-year-old son.
  • The police have filed an Accidental Death Report and initiated an investigation.
“He collapsed during the game and could not be revived,” said a witness.

This unfortunate incident highlights the unpredictability of health emergencies, even during seemingly regular activities like sports.

item.title: Google comes up with a witty reply to Jasprit Bumrah’s 'search it' remark - The Times of India
item.description:
Google Delivers a Clever Comeback to Jasprit Bumrah’s 'Search It' Comment

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

The article discusses a humorous exchange between Indian cricketer Jasprit Bumrah and Google, sparked by Bumrah's cheeky remark during a press conference about his batting skills.

  • Jasprit Bumrah made a light-hearted comment regarding his batting prowess, urging the reporter to 'search it' on Google.
  • The banter occurred after Bumrah's notable performance where he helped India avoid a follow-on in a match against Australia.
  • Google responded humorously on their X platform, elevating the playful interaction.
  • The moment quickly gained traction on social media, showcasing Bumrah's blend of skill and humor.
“But, you are questioning my batting ability. You should use Google and see who has got the most number of runs in a Test over.” - Jasprit Bumrah

This exchange illustrates how Bumrah's personality resonates with fans, while also demonstrating the engaging nature of social media interactions between public figures and tech companies.

item.title: Virat Kohli Goes Through Many Emotions As India Avoid Follow-On In 3rd Australia Test - Video Is Vir.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Virat Kohli Goes Through Many Emotions As India Avoid Follow-On In 3rd Australia Test - Video Is Viral

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: NDTV

This article covers India's tense final session on Day 4 of the third Test against Australia, where a critical 10th-wicket partnership helped India avoid a follow-on, highlighting Kohli's emotional response to the moment.

  • Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep formed a resilient 10th-wicket partnership to thwart Australia.
  • The partnership ensured India did not have to bat again immediately, with the match heading towards a draw.
  • Virat Kohli displayed a range of emotions captured in a viral video during the match.
  • KL Rahul praised the effort of the lower-order batsmen, emphasizing its importance in the match.
  • The five-match series is currently tied at 1-1.
“To avoid that follow-on makes a huge difference.” - KL Rahul

India displayed great resilience, showcasing their determination in a match that will likely influence the rest of the series.

item.title: World Chess Championship: Meet the man behind D Gukesh’s rapid rise to become king of the 64 squares - The Indian Express
item.description:
World Chess Championship: Meet the man behind D Gukesh’s rapid rise to become king of the 64 squares

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: The Indian Express

D Gukesh has made history by becoming the youngest-ever Chess World Champion, and at the center of his success is his mentor, MVM Velmohan, who has supported him since childhood.

  • Gukesh was recognized as a child with potential by chess coordinator Velavan Subbiah.
  • Velmohan attended Gukesh’s championship crowning in Singapore to celebrate his achievement.
  • The Velammal School is pivotal in nurturing young chess talent in Tamil Nadu, producing numerous Grandmasters.
  • Gukesh is among the many students who have benefitted from special coaching and extensive exposure tours.
  • Velmohan aims to produce at least 50 Grandmasters by 2030.
“These occasions are inspirational. Gukesh got inspired by Anand and today he is the world champion… it is a cycle.” - MVM Velmohan

The story of Gukesh and Velmohan highlights the importance of mentorship and support in achieving greatness in sports.

item.title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane

Date: Tuesday, Publication: Indian Express

After Day 4 of the third Test at Gabba, India scored 252/9, avoiding follow-on against Australia. KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja made significant contributions to keep the match competitive.

  • India trails by 193 runs but has crossed the 246 run mark, preventing Australia from enforcing a follow-on.
  • Josh Hazlewood is out of the Test due to injury.
  • The series stands at 1-1 after India won the first Test and Australia claimed victory in Adelaide.
“Raining Indian wickets at Gabba” - A difficult day for Indian batters.

The match remains open for a draw as India seeks to recover in the ongoing series.

item.title: 'He's done it for so many years': KL Rahul shows what India miss without Ravindra Jadeja in their Playing XI - Hindustan Times
item.description:
KL Rahul Highlights Importance of Ravindra Jadeja in India's XI

Date: Dec 17, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent cricket match, KL Rahul praised Ravindra Jadeja for his impressive batting performance that played a crucial role in India's innings during the Brisbane Test against Australia.

  • Jadeja scored 77 runs off 123 balls, helping stabilize the innings after early wickets.
  • Rahul and Jadeja shared a vital 67-run stand for the sixth wicket.
  • Jadeja's contribution helped India avoid follow-on and set a competitive score.
“Jadeja was brilliant today. He has been brilliant batting down the order for us for many, many years,” said Rahul.

Rahul emphasized that Jadeja’s consistent performance is key to India’s success, highlighting how he often delivers under pressure with not only his bowling but also his batting skills.

item.title: Rain To Ruin Action-Packed Day 5 Of India vs Australia 3rd Test In Brisbane? Report Says... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rain To Ruin Action-Packed Day 5 Of India vs Australia 3rd Test In Brisbane? Report Says...

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: ESPNcricinfo

The third Test match between India and Australia at the Gabba is under threat from rain, with a high chance of showers expected on the final day of the match. India has put up a strong fight, but the weather may impact their chances of making a comeback.

  • Australia's Bureau of Meteorology forecasts high chances of rain and possible severe thunderstorms on the last day.
  • India ended day four at 252/9, trailing by 193 runs, after notable performances from KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja.
  • KL Rahul expressed frustration over the interruptions due to the rain.
  • With the series tied at 1-1, this match's outcome is crucial.
“I think I got more tired running up and down from the dressing room than I did being in the middle.” - KL Rahul

With rain looming, both teams face a challenging end to the match which could shift the momentum at a critical point in the series.

item.title: Watch: Virat Kohli Stunned, Gautam Gambhir Delighted As Akash Deep Hits Pat Cummins For Mammoth Six - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Virat Kohli Stunned, Gautam Gambhir Delighted As Akash Deep Hits Pat Cummins For Mammoth Six

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

In an exhilarating moment during the third Test between India and Australia, Akash Deep hit a massive six off Pat Cummins, leaving Virat Kohli stunned and Gautam Gambhir delighted. This moment followed a pivotal partnership that helped India avoid a follow-on.

  • Akash Deep hit a six over deep mid-wicket against Cummins.
  • The Indian dressing room celebrated avoiding follow-on after Deep's explosive hit.
  • Jadeja and Rahul contributed significantly with their fighting fifties.
  • The match is significantly affected by inclement weather and is leaning towards a draw.
"Rohit, Gambhir and Kohli's reaction on Akash deep six against Pat Cummins" — Kuljot (@Kuljot__)

India's batting performance showcased resilience despite challenging conditions, with a close call caused by weather disruptions.

item.title: Ravindra Jadeja refuses to be ignored after Gabba rescue act; Gambhir, Rohit forced to think twice before benching him - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravindra Jadeja once again proved to be India's crisis man, forcing the team management to think about their decision to bench him in SENA nations.

Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Ravindra Jadeja showcased his pivotal role in the Indian cricket team at the Gabba, leading to a reevaluation of his status as a key player after previously being benched.

  • Jadeja has been a part of the top six since October 2019, averaging 38.93 in 35 Tests.
  • He has shown a significant improvement in his batting, scoring three of his four Test centuries in the last five years.
  • His performance at the Gabba included a vital 77 runs contributing to India's follow-on efforts.
  • His batting style emphasizes patience and minimalism, focusing on the task rather than flamboyance.
“I am a Rajput but I can’t bring a sword to the ground, so I use my bat as a sword.”

Jadeja's impressive performance reinforces his value to the team, making it clear that he cannot be sidelined again in future matches.
